intro: Tithymalopsis gracilis, commonly known as the slender tithymal, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Tithymalopsis gracilis is often grown as an ornamental plant for its aesthetic appeal and fragrant foliage.
